intro: Wercklea woodsonii, commonly known as the Texas star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
